select.label: Please select the WWARN modules for which this study has data...

input.label: When did the study start?
input.hint: Enter the date on which the study started, e.g., 2006-11-23.

input.label: When did the study end?
input.hint: Enter the year in which the study ended, e.g., 2008-06-30, or leave blank if the study is ongoing.

html.p: Who was the principal investigator of this study?

input.label: Home page?
input.hint: Enter the URL of a web page that is the person's home page.

input.label: Host organisation or institution?
input.hint: Enter the name of the person's host organisation or institution.

p.em: You can add another principal investigator by clicking the "+" button below.

html.p: Describe the site (location) where study subjects were recruited from...

p.em: If the study involves more than one site, what identifier (i.e., code) is used for this site in the submitted study data?
You can add another site by clicking the "+" button below.

html.p: Is this study described in any published research papers?

p.em: You can add another publication by clicking the "+" button below.

input.label: When can data be put on web?

p.em: Use the "+" button below to add another regimen.

item.label: (please select if more than one regimen)

html.p: Please complete the section below for each drug...

p.em: Use the "+" button below to add another drug.

html.p: Please complete the section below for each treatment regimen...

item.label: (please select if more than 1 treatment regimen)

p.em: Use the "+" button below to add another treatment regimen.

view.inlinehtml: What were the inclusion criteria for your in vitro study?

html.em: For each of your sites, please complete the section below. If the details are the same for each sub-site, leave blank after the first sub-site.
Enter a code for one of the sites defined in the general questions above.

select1.label: What was the delay between sampling and testing?
What was the transport and storage temperature?

p.em: Use the "+" button below to enter information for another site.

input.label: Where did the analysis take place?

html.em: Enter a site code, or laboratory name and address if the analysis did not take place at any of the previously entered sites.
Don't forget to monitor the incubator system.
Healthy erythrocytes have to be deleucocyted.
Storage temperature: 6 months at -20°C and 1 week at +4°C after using.

p.em: If you use antibiotics, please fill in the section below for each antibiotic you use.
Use the "+" button below to add another antibiotic.

html.em: If this is different for each sample, please include this information in your raw data.
If this is different for each sample, please include this information in your raw data.

p.em: Please complete the section below for each drug stock solution used.
Storage temperature and shelf lives for each solution will be determined and indicated.

select1.label: Were stock solutions provided by WWARN?

p.em: Use the "+" button below to add another drug stock solution.

select1.label: Are your plates prepared in batches or extemporaneous?

input.label: If clone was not provided by WWARN, who provided the clone?

select1.label: Are you entering data for one or several batches of plates?
Are your batch preparation dates and 3D7 information included with the raw data?

html.em: If batch preparation dates and 3D7 information are not included with the raw data, please complete the section below for each batch.

p.em: Use the "+" button below to add another batch.

p.b: Before filling in this section please submit clinical data and complete the clinical study questionnaire.

html.h5: How were clinical samples selected to be genotyped for molecular markers of resistance?

select1.label: Samples taken on day of treatment failure?

p.em: Use the "+" button below to add another day.

select1.label: Samples selected for genotyping molecular markers of resistance?

input.label: When were samples isolated from patients?

p.em: You can add another resistance marker by clicking the "+" button below.

select.label: How were mixed genotype resistance loci designated in the data set?

item.label: Designated as mixed (listed as mixed or both alleles reported: e.g. K/T)
Designated as mutant (only mutant allele is reported)

p.em: You can add more resistance loci by clicking the "+" button below.
You can add more loci by clicking the "+" button below.
